headline: Easy Carrot Cake
description: This recipe makes a fabulous and moist carrot cake. Try it for Thanksgiving instead of or in addition to pumpkin pie.
name: Easy Carrot Cake

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease one 9 or 10 inch tube pan.
Combine the sugar, flour, salt, cinnamon, soda, oil. With an electric mixer beat in the eggs one at a time. Stir in the carrots and the walnuts. Pour the batter into the prepared baking pan.
Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 1 hour 20 minutes. Note: this cake can be made in two 9 inch layer cake pans just change the baking time to 40 minutes.
To Make Frosting: With an electric mixer blend the cream cheese and cream. Add the vanilla and confectioners' sugar. Frosting can be spread and a still warm cake.

review.reviewBody: I followed this recipe as written and reduce it by half to make cupcakes. The only confusing part is the ounces written for the cream cheese. A package of cream cheese is 8 ounces not 3. So I went with my gut and used 4 ounces for my half recipe. This yield 9 cup cakes. I baked them for 40 mins. The cake was moist and texture ratio was perfect. The frosting was easy and turned out silky and smooth. Very delicious!!! My son approved. Thank you
Super easy and delicious
My grandson loved this cake I made for his birthday. Carrot cake is his favorite. I made it according to the directions and it was excellent n

Made this recipe as directed except I used 2 tsp of baking soda. Put it in a 9 inch bundt pan and the family thought it was terrific. I think it raised up perfect, heavy and moist but not too heavy. My frosting looked pretty sloppy but that was operator error, texture and taste were good.

This was a quick easy recipe, and the first Carrot cake I've ever made. The first time I made it as suggested, everyone loved it, I thought it was to oily. The second time I cut the oil to one cup and for the frosting used 2 packages of cream cheese and enough powdered sugar to get it to my level of desired sweetness (maybe a cup?).
Love it although its very rich in calories lol

I made this for a friends' birthday. I was cautiously hopeful. It was a fantastic result! The only thing I would alter would be the icing. maybe would like a little thicker. But a divine taste treat, both cake and icing joined, for the palate!

What a great carrot cake! Can’t stop sneaking a bite every time I walk by. A Easter lunch hit for sure! Super moist and easy! Be sure to prep pans really good. It stuck a tiny bit coming out of the pans but held together.
Great recipe! Like others I added 1 tsp baking powder and cut the oil to 1 cup. Came out great!
This cake came out really good and moist. My family and I enjoyed it.
Just added nutmeg. Other than that great recipe!

I make a carrot cake every year for my father for his birthday and I have never used the same recipe twice. I will definitely do this one again. I may try the modification of baking powder like others say they did and I might use 1/4 less oil just to see if those modifications make it better. But we LOVED it as is and happy to keep it just the way it is written here. I made the frosting just as written and will be using it as my go to cream cheese frosting from now on. For just once a year it is worth all the decadence this cake has to offer.
Delicious! I make cupcakes and omitted the coconut but this was so good. Topped with cream cheese icing. Yes!

It very easy to make! the recipe doesn't lie! The only thing I change was not adding as much sugar on the frosting. To avoid making the frosting not as sweet I used one cup of the sugar it asked for. It came out so delicious! thank you!
Was really good! The family loved it!
I loved this! Instead of 1 1/2 C of oil, I used 1 C of plain Greek yogurt and 1/2 C of oil. Turned out perfectly! I made my own cream cheese frosting. I will definitely make this again!
My first carrot cake!! Super easy and cake out great! Added some pineapple and used less sugar. Everyone loved it!

This is basically good. The only thing I didn't like is that it's way too oily. If I make this again, I'll do one of the three:
1. Just make the frosting. It was delicious
2. Cut the oil in half
3. Replace the oil with applesauce
these was so simple to do . and the family didn't even know it wasnt the one I always make that take FOREVER ! to make . I applaud u great recipe love it !!!

This is my second time making this and it is always a huge hit. I did use a full 8 ounces of cream cheese with the 2.5 cups of confectioners sugar because I felt the icing was too sweet otherwise. I also made this with gluten free flour due to the fact that I have an allergy. Turned out perfectly with the GF flour! Tried and true recipe!

I used this recipe flat out for my grandma’s bday, and she LOVED IT. I took it out of the oven much earlier and it was still not as moist as I was hoping, but that easily could’ve been some incorrect measurement, etc. I also added little embellishments with white chocolate and walnuts, (mainly to cover up my terrible frosting job). I’d definitely go for twice the frosting. I made a layer cake with only two layers and I had to make a second batch of frosting to cover it all. Although, I think that anyone only doing 1 layer will be fine if you’re not too generous. Otherwise, I absolutely loved it, and so did my extended family. Additionally, that frosting is TO DIE FOR.

This is my 2nd bake ever. Recipe was easy to follow... assuming you do better than I did and get the ingredients BEFORE you start the process. :P Otherwise, it's a good process. My icing looks like and I'm hoping it doesnt taste grainy.
Purée the pineapple! I was able to reduce the sugar to only 1 cup and it was still sweet and extremely moist.
Easy and delicious
Great recipe
This was delicious! I will make it again, probably using less coconut. I have several family members that are not a fan of coconut. I was afraid that I cooked it too long, but it was perfectly moist.
It turned out edible but it was flat in flavor.
Love this cake! I have a family recipe for the frosting so I cannot comment on that but this cake is fabulous!
I reduced the oil to 3/4 cup and sugar to 1 1/2 cups. The cake was moist and received ‘please make this again’ comments

I've made this twice now, and every time it comes out nice and moist. The first time I used the amount of oil the recipe called for, but the second time I cut it in half. 
I absolutely love this recipe!
Yummmm! I followed what everyone has said but instead of using white sugar, I used all brown sugar. Turned out really good and yummy.
I’ve never made carrot cake before! It was delicious. My whole family raved.
Moist cage and it makes great cupcakes too
I made this cake today using (2) 9-inch round pans. I recommend baking for only 35 minutes (mine stuck to the pans). Also, I would double the icing recipe.
Not overly fluffy. Reminds me more of a brownie consistency.

Simple recipe that turned out delicious! Read the reviews befor I made this and I took the advice from others by reducing the oil to 1 cup and used 1 tsp of baking powder in addition to the baking soda. Since I made these changes I rated it a 4/5 because according to others it is not a 5/5 as is. Still saving this one in he books to make again with these positive changes. I made my own cream cheese frosting, not the frosting from this particular recipe. I used two 9 inch pans baking them at 325 for 35-40 minutes.
I put mine in a bundt cake pan and it turned out great!
Delicious!
I used Trindell’s suggestions and it turned out AMAZING!!!!

I will make this again - great way to use a lot of carrots. I made the recipe almost as is; I used more carrots than called for, to get rid of what I had, but it didn't change the flavor. If anything, the cake was very moist and had a perfect consistency. I made in 2 8" cake pans, and put the left-over batter in mini-muffin tins. This cake was so good I ended up not putting any frosting on it, we ate it plain and it was delicious!
I used this recipe for the frosting recipe. The frosting turned out yummy!
Your cake is really yummy
I made this exactly as the recipe is written. It was a huge success however I felt it was a little dry. Next time I won’t bake it as long and I’m confident that will solve the problem.

I've been practicing some items for a birthday party I'm hosting. I'm an advanced-beginner at baking. The recipe was EASY and was a HIT at my office (they are my test subjects). I made it in three 9" cake pans and used the cream cheese icing (I think #2) from this site. AMAZING. Taste, texture, consistency, and moist.
SUPER YUMMY! I read comments and only did 1 1/4 cups oil and added a teaspoon of baking powder. I suggest doubling the icing if you plan on a layer cake.
easy peasy... And tastes great!
Good balance of flavors! I added baking powder, as others mentioned. I should have put in less oil - it was too greasy as written. Next time I'm adding coconut flakes.

Loved it! Was so easy to make and so very moist. I always put more pecans than called for, which I did again. Made it in a bundt pan, and instead of cream cheese frosting, I made a glaze and dribbled it on. Glaze: 2 cups powdered sugar and a little lemon juice, just enough to wet the sugar,might have been a tablespoon, and then just drizzle on.

I use unsweetened applesauce for most of the oil. I also add coarsely chopped walnuts and shredded coconut to the batter. What a wonderful treat!!!! Canned, drained, crushed pineapple might be a yummy addition too. I'm sure you wouldn't want to put more than 1/4 c. In the batter.
Amazing. I cut the oil to one cup, as others had recommended, and use a cup of honey instead of two cups of sugar. Perfect.

made it for my moms birthday, wayyy to much oil, i used a cup of oil and half a cup of butter(i ran out of oil) with an additional half cup of rum. when it came out of the pan it was greasy. I would keep the single cup of oil and half cup of alcohol but no more.
I followed the recipe exactly except I baked it in a 9 by 13 inch baking dish. I also used cream cheese frosting. The entire office raved, especially about the moistness.
Perfect carrot cake.

This is the best carrot cake recipe! It's simple to make and the icing is also great. My family asks for it for birthday celebrations. I make mine a layer cake, double the icing and refrigerate for a few hours so the icing hardens up.
Couple of changes - 1/2 cup oil, 1 cup unsweetened applesauce. Frosting - 8 oz cream cheese softened additional heavy cream (TBSP) for consistency.

I made it but took the recommendations of others and only used 1 cup of oil but then changed it to 1/2 c browned butter and 1/2 c oil. I baked it in 2 9" pans for 35 minutes and frosted it with Cream Cheese Frosting II from All Recipes. It was perfection!
Love this recipe I added baking powder and nut meg. No walnuts.

I made this carrot cake. It's very moist and tasty. I did make a few changes by substituting the flour for cake flour, only using 1 cup of vegetable oil and using 3- 9 inch cake pans. Baking the 3 cakes at 350° for 25 minutes. My husband loves it.
Fabulous cake! A big hit for holidays & birthdays!
Not for me. The cake was oily and eggy without much flavor.
I really enjoyed this recipe, though I used two pans and baked it for 30mins, and only used 1 & 1/2 cups of icing sugar in the frosting. Still a good recipe and will probably bake again
I took the suggestion from one of the other reviews to use only 1 cup of oil and it was prefect!
No one ate it. Followed the direction exact. Will never make again

This is the perfect old fashioned carrot cake recipe I have been looking for! I did use less oil as others had commented and it was still very moist. My husband is a carrot cake eficianado and he loved it!

I normally use the Sam's Famous Carrot cake recipe on here (if you haven't tried it, you must!) but I didn't have any pineapple and was in a pinch so I tried this one as a back up. I would say it's "Just ok". I wish I would have read the other reviews so I would have known to add baking powder and reduce the oil, because it really did need it. It came out dense and oily. I don't mind dense carrot cake per say, in fact the Sam's one is pretty dense, but this one just didn't have the flavor I was looking for. I would say this is a good stand by easy recipe though if you just want to make something quick. I would say, add the baking powder, reduce the oil, and add more cinnamon than recipe calls for. I also did not use the frosting recipe and used the Cream Cheese icing II one (it really is the best).
so easy and fun to make. Cake tasted wonderful.

This cake turned out very very good! Was light and fluffy and good flavor!
I used the posted recipe as a base but made a few changes as recommended in the comments:
Cake:
I used no walnuts.
I used only 1 1/4 cup Canola Oil.
Added 1 cup of dark raisins.
Added 1 Tbsp. Baking Soda.
Added 1 tsp ground Nutmeg.
Added 1 tsp ground Cardamom.
Frosting:
I used a version of the Cream Cheese Frosting II recipe but changed the ratios to:
5/8 cup Cream Cheese.
3 Tbsp. Butter.
1 Cup Confectioners Sugar.
1 tsp vanilla extract.
This was enough to fully cover the top and sides of the cake baked in a 9" Bundt pan.
Next time I will try it with a jar of carrot baby food.

My kids know I love carrot cake and asked me to find a recipe. After much looking, we settled in this one. My 12 and 13Yo made this cake as per the instructions with two small changes. They swapped sun-maid Raisins for the walnuts and did have the carrots in a Parmesan grater making more of a mush than strings. Well after they completed it and iced it I have to say this is truly a very moist cake and probably the best carrot cake I can remember eating! We will make this again! Note we did use a convection oven set for baking.
Moist and delicious!
very dry cake. I used my mixer for doing every part of it. i won't use this recipe anymore

I've made this cake several times! Making it for hubby's b day party Saturday!!! It's so moist and delicious and everyone asked for the recipe every single time! I recommend this recipe over any other carrot cake recipe because I have made several different ones and this by far is the best!
My husband's fave. We even eat it for breakfast, great as desert too though.
absolutely the best recipe ever. needs baking powder though.
I just made this cake today and my family and I loved it! The only adjustment I made was not adding heavy cream in my frosting, other than that I think this recipe deserves 5 stars!

First carrot cake I've ever made and turned out GREAT! Even the kids loved it. I did use a different cream cheese frosting recipe just because I didn't have whipping cream. I'll be sticking to this recipe
Exchanged flour for self rising flour and left out salt and soda. It was amazing!!! Made this in cupcakes and backed for 18 min, turned out perfect!

I am "famous" in my family for my carrot cake, but I lost my recipe that I have used for decades. To this recipe, I added 2 tsps of baking powder per previous reviews, and used Cream Cheese Frosting II. The second time I made it, I only used 1 cup of oil per other's suggestions. It was delicious and my family loved it even more than before.
Way too greasy. Too much oil
I loved it!!! it was amazing!!
This cake was AWESOME! it was nice and moist and the frosting was perfect!
Easy to make and such a moist cake...for the icing only added 1.5 confectioner sugar
It was so good!!!
This is the best.

Very good cake! It was my first carrot cake and everyone loved it for our Thanksgiving diner. I just added the 2tps baking powder and reduced the oil to 1/4 cup after reading the most helpful critical review. Also omitted the walnuts. Easy and delicious!

Came out very well using our 10 inch tube pan and baking approx. 50 minutes. (After 40 minutes, it appeared done, but when I cut a slice, it was not; it looked baked but still smelled like batter. After heating the oven again, and then cooking 10 more minutes, it was perfect.) Moist and enjoyable cake. (Note: I didn't make the frosting. Used approx. 5 large grated carrots.)
The cake is great but the frosting has way to much sugar. I only used 2 cups of sugar in the frosting.

I disagree with the other reviews do not use baking powder use ingredients as it says just separate wet and dry ingredients before mixing all together I also hand mixed with a spoon it turned ot to be very moist and fluffy not dense at all my family keeps begging for more thanx for the awesome recipe I will be using it often

I agree with TRindell's review. This carrot cake was great with her suggestions. Everyone really enjoyed it-- and it tasted even better the second and third day. I made mine in a 9x13 dish and used a half recipe of the Cream Cheese Frosting II to coat it. Very nice. Finely grating a pound of carrots can be taxing work, but other than that this recipe was very easy. I will be making it again.
It was a good recipe. I added pineapple which was super yummy.
Added raisins, cut the oil to 1 cup and subbed 1/2 cup applesauce for the rest of the oil to reduce fat and since I had 4 cups of shredded carrots, went with it. Turned out awesome.
Delicious. I followed the reviews & added baking powder (2 tsp.). Made it for my daughter's birthday & it was a big hit.

Excellent, moist delicious cake. I added extra walnuts on top of the cake. Next time, I am going to cut the oil in half and use unsweetened applesauce to make it a bit healthiear. I made mine in a 13x9 pan and it was perfect!

Unfortunately, I chose this recipe without reading the reviews because I was in a hurry! Too much oil, I should have reduced it. It cooked 10 min past the recommended time and still wasn't completely done.

Not too pleased with the frosting either. Had to add more sugar to have any consistency and still not firm enough, Next time I'll try one of the other recipes! Brenda 08/11/2013

WOW!
I just made this cake and can't stop eating it!

I did make a couple of alterations, as per other reviewers, but I'm sure it would still be a 5 star even if I'd followed the recipe as written.

This is what I did...

substituted 1/2 the oil for applesauce,
added 2 tsp baking powder,
added couple rasps of nutmeg,
added mashed ripe banana,
added chocolate chips and raisins as I didn't have walnuts,
no icing as I was just too lazy

I really enjoyed this recipe. I used it to make muffins. I substituted the sugar with Splenda blend for health reasons. I baked at the same temperature for 25 minutes and they came out perfect. I used a pampered chef muffin pan and got my 24 servings from this recipe. I enjoyed without the frosting. I read the reviews before baking and decided to give it a shot. Soooo not disappointed. Thank you for the recipe.. Kashmir

Amazing! I made it for a bridal shower, and one girl told me she doesn't like carrot cake and that she got a slice to be polite. Planned to only have one bite....ended up eating the whole thing and raved about how good it was. People at the shower wanted the recipe. So good. I used a different icing recipe, but the cake itself was so good.
Made some changes to this. Added 1 tsp vanilla; 1/2 c sour cream and only 1 c oil. It came out really good. Nice and moist!
Nice, moist cake. Bakes up nicely. Only added nutmeg simply because I like nutmeg.

I make this recipe on a regular basis and it always turns out great. I do, however, add a tsp of baking powder. I usually make it in two rounds and bake in my convection oven at 325 degrees for 38-40 minutes. Now, if I could figure out how to eat more of it and keep my weight down ...
